definition: (literary) (of fruit, achievements etc) clusters of/piles of/heaps of/gaunt/haggard/wretched/Taiwan pr. [lei3 lei3]
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
heavily laden with fruit/fertile (of trees)/many noteworthy achievements
debts of blood crying out for retribution
lit. prodigious abundance of fruit (idiom)/fruit hangs heavy on the bough/fig. countless accomplishments/one great result after another

sentences.english: The anti-aircraft guns riddled the plane's wings with bullets.
sentences.chinese: 防空炮把机翼打得弹痕累累。

sentences.english: Shunde, a small city in Guangdong, was buried in debt.
sentences.chinese: 而位于广东省的顺德市，此时也是负债累累。

sentences.english: The fields in autumn are fruity.
France was 18th, and Greece, saddled with debt, fell to 90th.
sentences.chinese: 法国是第18名，负债累累的希腊降到了第90名。

sentences.english: His gambling losses put him deeply [heavily] in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他因赌博输钱而负债累累。

sentences.english: His scar tissue came from battles both actual and political.
sentences.chinese: 他在军事战斗和政治斗争中都伤痕累累。

sentences.english: The branches hung down to the ground with the weight of the apples.
sentences.chinese: 果实累累的苹果树枝低垂到地面。

sentences.english: Sixty years of fruitful construction process, the future of the new century entrepreneurial road fairview.
sentences.chinese: 六十年建设历程硕果累累，新世纪创业道路前程锦绣。

sentences.english: A jagged scar runs down his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 他的额头上交织着累累疤痕。

sentences.english: Swallow also passed the best in the world and the difficult test of judicial examination, fruits.
sentences.chinese: 而海燕也通过了天下第一难考的司法考试，硕果累累。

sentences.english: Her arm was black and blue from the accident.
sentences.chinese: 她的手臂因车祸而伤痕累累。

sentences.english: Now consumers are so heavily indebted that they cannot borrow more.
sentences.chinese: 现在，消费者如此负债累累，他们已无法借得更多了。

sentences.english: The high-speed rail is losing money. Should the government take over?
sentences.chinese: 高铁亏损累累，你认为政府该不该接管？

sentences.english: The travel seems to be paying off.
sentences.chinese: 这次旅行的成果似乎硕果累累。

sentences.english: On studying of the station troops culture, we have made great achievements recently.
sentences.chinese: 对贵州屯堡文化的研究，近年来硕果累累。

sentences.english: After years of borrowing, Greece is in debt.
sentences.chinese: 在借钱多年之后，希腊负债累累。

definition: wound/skin ulcer/(fig.) the desolation of trauma/desolation in the aftermath of a disaster
lit. bumps and bruises everywhere (idiom); fig. an ugly shambles/devastation everywhere
so many that the bamboo slats have been exhausted/innumerable crimes (idiom)/see also 罄筆難書|罄笔难书[qing4 bi3 nan2 shu1]
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
covering the whole land/over hills and dales
